1.title: Built a Nest.js backend for a blog application

a.title: Blog CRUD Functionality Implementation
a.i: Established relational database relationships between users, posts, categories, and groups using PostgreSQL
a.ii: Developed related post recommendation API based on score-based relevancy algorithm
a.iii: Implemented image insertion during blog editing and thumbnail registration process. For large buffer images, provided presigned URLs to enable direct client-side uploads to S3.

b.title: Abstract authentication and authorization using Guards and custom Decorators.
b.i: Use TypeORM QueryBuilder to manipulate SQL queries easily.
b.ii: Generate related posts based on a score-based relevance algorithm.
b.iii: Send presigned S3 URLs to the frontend so that images inserted during blog editing are uploaded directly from the client to S3.

c.title: Optimized CI/CD for Docker and AWS EC2 deployment
c.i: Containerized Nest.js app and PostgreSQL database using Docker Compose and deployed via Docker images
c.ii: Mirrored local development environment using Docker
c.iii: Automated deployment with GitHub Actions: SSH into EC2, pull the latest Docker image, and restart the container
c.iv: Removed old Docker image caches, keeping only the latest 3 images during deployment

2.title: Separation of concerns between server components and client components based on authentication/authorization

a.i: Process SEO-critical and public data in server components.
a.ii: For data requiring authentication/authorization, guide it to be fetched within client components with httpOnly cookies.
a.iii: In case of private posts, first call from server component without token, and if 401 error is returned, set up a structure to refetch with authentication information in client component
a.iv: Due to JWT strategy setting short access token lifespan, the process of reissuing tokens upon expiration is inevitably necessary.
a.v: However, when handling reissuance in server components, httpOnly cookies are not automatically set in the browser (because the requester is not the browser). Therefore, a process to set them in the browser from server-side is required.
a.vi: Since such inconveniences occur when managing authentication on the server-side, authentication management is delegated to client components. Separation of concerns decision

3.title: Built high-quality components by combining an interactive animation library with Headless UI.
3.a: Connected major wallets such as MetaMask and WalletConnect, and retrieved wallet information
3.b: Calculated the delta between mousedown and mouseup pageX values to determine the swipe direction; if the delta exceeded a certain threshold, the carousel advanced to the next slide
3.c: Used useEffect and setInterval to create an infinite slide animation that runs every 3 seconds, with mouseenter and mouseleave events used to pause and resume the animation. Cleaned up the interval on page unmount to prevent memory leaks

bumangRoute53.4: Implemented utility features such as i18n (internationalization) and dark mode.

seaPearl.desc: Tap Game on Telegram Mini App

1.title: Built and deployed an initial product using a webview-based frontend within Telegram.
1.a: Configured the Telegram development environment using ngrok, and used it for both development and deployment.

b.title: Deployed the frontend as a webview within an iframe-based mini app environment.
b.i: Implemented an initialization logic that retrieves user authentication data using Telegram Mini App global browser APIs.
b.ii: To enable the use of Mini App APIs in development, the local environment was exposed via ngrok and registered with the Telegram bot.

2.title: Integrated Adsgram for in-app advertising.
2.a: Implemented a logic to receive success/failure results from the Adsgram server and forward them to the backend API server.
2.b: Treated ad viewing as failed if the user skips the ad, sends the app to background, or remains on the app manager screen.

3.title: Used react-virtuoso to build a virtualized list.
3.a: Configured the virtualized list to handle infinitely growing data lists.

4.title: Optimized API calls for the tapping game using debounce and global caching, balancing between cost efficiency and security.

a.title: Aggregated tapping counts with a debounce and sent to the server 3 seconds after the last tap.
a.i: If the user exits the screen within 3 seconds, used a useEffect cleanup function to ensure server update before unmounting.
a.ii: Made the tap count a persistent global state so that the count is sent to the server even after unexpected termination upon app restart.
a.iii: In the global state update function, combined server patching and state clearing so that if an unexpected error occurs, the original state remains intact.

a.title: Aggregated tapping counts with a debounce and sent to the server 3 seconds after the last tap.
a.i: Used random values to control the Bezier path direction of point-gain animations, with each tap having a 1 in 3 chance to earn points, enhancing the visual experience.

anttimeSwap.desc: Point to Token Airdrop Exchange Platform

1.title: Developing a Strategy for Utilizing React Server Components and Client Components
1.a: Retrieved token swap period metadata on the server side to manage access control
1.b: Strengthened security by avoiding exposure of authorization logic based on permissions or timing in client-side code
1.c: Defined clear use cases for Server Components (e.g., SEO-critical pages) and Client Components depending on rendering needs

2.title: Separation of Concerns by State Using TanStack Query's useSuspenseQuery with Suspense and ErrorBoundary
2.a: Used Suspense and ErrorBoundary to isolate loading/error states and reduce component complexity
2.b: Designed architecture to minimize API request blocking
2.c: Improved UX with skeleton loaders during async loading
2.d: Used Suspensive library‚Äôs ClientOnly option for components requiring client-side dependencies in an SSR environment

3.title: Implemented Web3 wallet connection and transaction handling using WAGMI
3.a: Connected major wallets such as MetaMask and WalletConnect, and retrieved wallet information
3.b: Enabled token swaps via smart contract interactions

4.title: Created a sequential ‚Äúscore evaluation‚Äù animation using GSAP
4.a: Shared animation timing state between components using useContext

a.title: Divide Native Build Config to Dev and Prod
a.i: Set up Firestore for each development environment and configured environment variable files accordingly
a.ii: Configured environment-specific setups for react-native-firebase during native builds using Xcode build schemes for iOS and Android flavors for Android.

2.title: Updated React Native version
2.a: Due to an outdated RN version, library support was discontinued, requiring the use of older library versions
2.b: Upgraded from 0.68 to 0.74 using React Native Upgrade Helper modified native code accordingly (removed Flipper, configured Fabric, updated iOS/Android metadata)
2.c: Upgraded library configurations to match the new RN version

3.title: Made DeepLink With Google Play Store Referral API
3.a: Developed deep links that redirect users to the appropriate store link based on their operating system
3.b: Additionally, used referral link query strings to pre-fill the referrer code upon app entry
3.c: Completed deep link integration with referrer code using the GOOGLE Play Store Referral API due to the deprecation of Firebase Dynamic Links

a.title: Developed a skin page that allows users to purchase individual body part skins using in-app currency
a.i: Implemented functionality to fetch user body part data and dynamically update skin animations and part replacements
a.ii: Released seasonal skins tailored to major holidays and events

b.title: Complex mining animation using React Native Reanimated
b.i: The original mining animation was implemented with Lottie, which played a single fixed animation of a character in a predefined outfit. To support skin updates, the animation needed to be separated into individual parts
b.ii: Used react-native-reanimated to create animation timelines for each part and implemented smooth, coordinated playback

a.title: Implemented Slide Animation
a.i: Developed a custom hook to determine whether the user can proceed to the next step, based on various business rules such as: 1st transfer price, 2nd price configuration status, 2nd price timing, 2nd price value, bank account registration status, Yanolja verification, and terms agreement status
a.ii: Calculated the delta between mousedown and mouseup pageX values to determine the swipe direction; if the delta exceeded a certain threshold, the carousel advanced to the next slide
a.iii: Used useEffect and setInterval to create an infinite slide animation that runs every 3 seconds, with mouseenter and mouseleave events used to pause and resume the animation. Cleaned up the interval on page unmount to prevent memory leaks

b.title: Provided a Consistent User Experience Across Mobile and Desktop
b.i: Enabled drag functionality for both mobile and desktop environments by supporting both TouchEvent and MouseEvent
b.ii: Prevented unintended clicks by canceling mouse events when a touch event was detected

2.title: Handling Complex Business Logic with Custom Hooks

a.title: Handled complex business logic exceptions using a custom hook
a.i: Developed a custom hook to determine whether the user can proceed to the next step, based on various business rules such as: 1st transfer price, 2nd price configuration status, 2nd price timing, 2nd price value, bank account registration status, Yanolja verification, and terms agreement status

b.title: Redirected to the payment method registration page if no payment method is available, while preserving the form state on return
b.i: Implemented a flow that preserves the user‚Äôs input when a bank account is not yet registered by switching to the payment method registration component within the same page, instead of navigating away. This ensured that all previously entered state remained intact
b.ii: Upon returning, while the internal state remained, some browser-controlled elements (e.g. checkbox checked states) were visually reset. This was resolved by creating a hook to restore UI consistency based on the current state during component transitions

3.title: Implemented Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) for push notifications
3.a: Created a custom hook to initialize the FCM token upon login
3.b: Received background push notifications via a Firebase service worker
3.c: Tested push notifications across Android, iOS, web, and PWA environments

4.title: Optimized SEO in React applications
4.a: Implemented pre-rendering using React Helmet and React Snap
4.b: Improved Lighthouse SEO score from 77 to 100 after optimization

5.title: Led team operations
5.a: Shared daily progress through morning stand-up meetings

b.title: Required full-team code reviews before merging.
b.i: Comments like "Good job" were discouraged ‚Äî reviewers were expected to leave meaningful feedback after reading the code carefully

c.title: Handled a mid-project situation where two teammates left to prepare for job interviews, affecting team morale
c.i: Reached out to the departing members to clarify which features they had been working on and what remained unfinished, then redistributed the tasks among the remaining team
c.ii: To maintain development momentum, we doubled down on thorough code reviews and built a culture of giving feedback within 3 hours of a PR being submitted. Positive reinforcement for good work was also emphasized
c.iii: As a result, one of the most productive teammates mentioned during the project retrospective that the supportive team culture kept them motivated through to the end
